content.question: A city planner developed the function <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to model the population of a city over the next 25 years, where <math alttext="P of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is the projected population of the city <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> years from now. According to the model, which of the following gives the rate at which the population of the city will be changing at time <math alttext="t equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="P of 6, minus P of 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction P of 5, over 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
